aboutAppContent: The application for assessing the critical condition of patients in the emergency department of Thammasat Chaloem Phra Kiat Hospital is a newly developed software designed as a tool for evaluating the critical condition of patients using the MEWS score calculation method, which will replace the manual tool used for recording patient crisis condition assessments.
name: Name
nursingHigh:
• Observe symptoms every 15-30 minutes for 3 times (every 15 minutes if score unchanged) and follow nursing standards.
• Report to the shift supervisor and manage nursing activities based on symptoms.
• Report to the intern or first-call doctor to review symptoms within 30 minutes/issue treatment orders.
 • If no improvement, report to the second-call & third-call doctors within 15 minutes to review symptoms and issue treatment orders.
 • Consider adding I/O recording every 2 hours if urine output <50 cc. in 2 hours, and report to the doctor.
 • If the MEWS score is 5 for 3 consecutive times, consult with the doctor regarding the possibility of transferring the patient to the ICU.
nursingLow: • Observe and assess symptoms, record vital signs every 8 hours, and monitor according to nursing standards.
nursingLowMedium:
• Observe and assess symptoms, record vital signs every 4 hours, and monitor according to nursing standards.
• Inform to the intern or 1st call physician to assess the condition within 30 minutes and follow treatment orders
nursingMedium:
• Observe and assess symptoms, record vital signs every 2 hours for 3 times (adjust to every 1 hours if the score maintain the same), and monitor according to nursing standards.
• Inform to the intern or 1st call physician to assess the condition within 30 minutes and follow treatment orders.
• If the condition does not improve, report to the 2nd call and 3rd call physicians to assess the condition within 30 minutes and follow treatment orders.
nursingMediumHigh:
• Observe and assess symptoms, record vital signs every 2 hours for 3 times (adjust to every 1 hours if the score maintain the same), and monitor according to nursing standards.
• Inform to the intern or 1st call physician to assess the condition within 30 minutes and follow treatment orders
• If the condition does not improve, report to the 2nd call and 3rd call physicians to assess the condition within 30 minutes and follow treatment orders.
• Consider increasing the recording of input/output every 4 hours. If urine output is less than 100 cc in 4 hours, report to the physician.
proceed?: Are you sure you want to proceed?
